summary: The Transaction and Sourcing Knowledge Act (TASK Act) mandates the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to require publicly traded companies to report on their sourcing and due diligence related to supply chains linked to forced labor in Xinjiang, China. The bill also requires reporting on transactions with companies on the Entity List or designated as Chinese Military-Industrial Complex Companies, and annual reporting on the presence and activities of Chinese Communist Party committees within US companies operating in China.
